definition: cigarette or pipe tobacco/CL:根[gen1]/smoke/mist/vapour/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/tobacco plant/(of the eyes) to be irritated by smoke
gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots

sentences.english: Joe is a heavy smoker. He smokes at least four packs of cigarettes a day!
sentences.chinese: 喬伊是個老煙槍，他一天至少抽四包煙。

sentences.english: A heavy smoker spends almost as much money a day as he pays for his own meals.
sentences.chinese: 一天一個老煙槍花差不多的錢支付他自己的食物。

sentences.english: Mr. Wang is not only a chain-smoker but also a heavy drinker.
sentences.chinese: 王先生不僅是個老煙槍，還是個老酒鬼。

sentences.english: He grabbed the bong and a lighter and knew exactly what to do.
sentences.chinese: 他手拿水煙槍和打火機，看起來很在行。

sentences.english: Although he chain-smoked cigarettes, his hands were unstained.
sentences.chinese: 雖然他是老煙槍，但他的手還沒有被燻黑。

sentences.english: At the time, he was a heavy smoker and occasional gambler.
sentences.chinese: 當時他是個老煙槍，還偶爾去賭博。

sentences.english: The sea with a pipe in the middle of the night to save Mr.
sentences.chinese: 於大海半夜帶着煙槍來救金戈。

sentences.english: If I try to stand up without my medicine, I won't make it.
sentences.chinese: 要是我想不用吃藥就能站起來，我不會拿起水煙槍的。

definition: Brokeback Mountain, 2005 English-language film by Ang Lee 李安[Li3 An1]
to be absent-minded/to desert/to abscond from the army/absent without leave (AWOL)
a form of theatrical double act in which one performer speaks or sings while the other, in front, pretends to be doing the speaking or singing/double reed (as in an oboe or bassoon)
lit. the lioness from Hedong roars (idiom)/fig. refers to a shrewish wife or a henpecked husband
